ygData.subject: Lambent breastplate quest peculiarity
ygData.msgSnippet: If this theory holds true then that will make it easier for lower level bards to complete the Mane Attraction quest, a subquest to the Raincaller bow quest.
ygData.messageBody:
If this theory holds true then that will make it easier for lower level
bards to complete the Mane Attraction quest, a subquest to the Raincaller
bow quest. Part of this quest requires you to get a toupee made for a gnome
in Akanon. The toupee adds +10 to charisma. Without spoiling all the
details, to get the toupee made requires a component off a mermaid in Kedge
Keep. This requires a high level party to accomplish. I've already
completed the first part of the quest but won't be able to get into Kedge
for at least 8-10 levels. Would be nice if a high level friend could loot
the item off the mermaid, turn it into the gnome, and then I turn in the
rest of the components and get the toupee. May be violating the spirit of
doing the quest for yourself but like my old First Sergeant used to say: "If
your not cheating your not trying!"

Galtin of E'ci



> Try Chanda/Baobob Miller in Q Hills as a test. They both have 2 item
> quests
> that are easy to complete.
>
> Rokenn
>
>
>
> >From: <kim@...>
> >Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
> >To: eqbards@onelist.com
> >Subject: Re: [eqbards] Lambent breastplate quest peculiarity
> >Date: Wed, 5 Jan 2000 14:41:11 -0500 (EST)
> >
> >On Wed, 5 Jan 2000, Rokenn Swiftsong wrote:
> > >
> > > It is a bug of a sort. Here is what happens: Lets say a quest requires
> 3
> > > items (X, Y, & Z). Player 1 gives the NPC items X, Y, and a third
> item
> >that
> > > is incorrect. Swears up & down at his bad fortune and stomps off.
> >Player 2
> > > comes up and gives the NPC item Z and gets the goods, and since she
> also
> > > gave the NPC items X & Y gets the "you have something else for me?"
> >message.
> >
> >Hmm, does this mean my cleric friend (who picked up a gypsy
> >lute when I wasn't there) could give the lute to the NPC, and
> >I could give the NPC the carapace and ruby lambent, and I
> >would get the breastplate?
> >
> >Do I really want to try this experiment considering it took me
> >3 days to get that damn carapace? Anyone know of a similar,
> >easier quest we could test this theory on first?
> >
>
